title: Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Window: Over Main Entrance - Lateral Building, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century
title_raw: Design for Stained Glass Window: Over Main Entrance - Lateral Building, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY
medium: brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board
inscribed:
recto, in graphite: Over Entrance - Lateral Building / (2 of These)

verso: writing in pen and black in that is obscured by remains of a paper label.
Below this in pen and black ink: no. 56
description: Lunette filled with tiles of different colors; interior a torch flanked by pink C-curves.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Design for Stained Glass Window: Over Main Entrance - Lateral Building, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY, late 19th century. brush and wash, gouache, graphite on paper mounted on tan illustration board. Gift of Alice C. Morse. 2009-6-1.
